description: This dashboard gives overview of OpenEBS installation in cluster.

panels.description:
This panel shows mem usage of  pods across $namespace in $cluster cluster.

Memory utilization is easily tracked with container_memory_usage_bytes, however, this metric also includes cached (think filesystem cache) items that can be evicted under memory pressure. That's why we are using a  better metric: container_memory_working_set_bytes as this is what the OOM killer is watching for.
panels.title: Memory usage by Pods in OpenEBS  in $cluster cluster

panels.description:
This panel shows mem usage of  pods across $namespace in $cluster cluster.

Memory utilization is easily tracked with container_memory_usage_bytes, however, this metric also includes cached (think filesystem cache) items that can be evicted under memory pressure. That's why we are using a  better metric: container_memory_working_set_bytes as this is what the OOM killer is watching for.
panels.title: CPU usage by Pods in OpenEBS  in $cluster cluster
pod count by nodes of $namespace in $cluster cluster

panels.description:
OpenEBS SLO is based on no. of running data plane OpenEBS pods over a period of time. Below pods have been taken into consideration which impacts data availability hosted on OpenEBS:

1. cstor pods
2. jiva ctrl and replica pods
3. nfs provisioner
panels.title: OpenEBS data plane availability over [$duration]

panels.description: This panel shows if there is any unhealthy OpenEBS  replicas on $cluster cluster.
panels.title: $cluster OpenEBS replicas

panels.description: This panel shows container restarts in $cluster cluster per namespace during $duration.
panels.title: pod container restarts in OpenEBS in $duration

title: OpenEBS Dashboard
